creator: christian.schulz@vattenfall.de
text:
It would be very nice and very usefull to be able to configure exclusions in 
the uriworkermap.properties. As I know so far, it is only possible to 
configure, which Sites/URLs should be redirected from Webserver to TomCat, but 
it is not possible to configure, which Sites/URLs should not be redirected.

For example, we have a CMS running within TomCat and redirect /ourcontext from 
Webserver to TomCat. But, as all kind of content comes from CMS, TomCat has 
also to deliver GIFs, PDFs etc.

For this usage, it would be great, if we would be able to say:

Ok, redirect
/ourcontext/
but don't redirect
/ourcontext/images/
and don't redirect
/ourcontext/static/

and so on.

Do you means JK 1.2.x or JK 2.0.x ?

BTW, I think it could help many of us who are puzzled via Location, Directory
and JkMount.

The directory could be :

JkMountExclude

I could take a look at these one...
creator: hgomez@apache.org

text:
Since 1.2.26, you can specify exclusion mappings in uriworkermap.properties

http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/reference/uriworkermap.html#Exclusion,%20Disabling%20and%20Priorities

Since 1.2.27, you can specify JkUnMount exclusions for Apache mod_jk

http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/reference/apache.html
